hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC 20-day realized volatility compresses below 30% while the 5-day average daily range is less than 2.5%, a breakout above the 20-day high on >1.5x average volume will signal a transition to a BULL regime with an average forward 5-day return of >3%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often represent consolidation periods where volatility compresses before directional moves. Low volatility combined with range compression suggests pent-up energy. A high-volume breakout above recent resistance indicates institutional accumulation and regime change initiation.
entry_conditions: Volume on breakout day > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% gain from entry or regime shifts to BULL with confidence > 70%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 2% loss from entry or price closes below 20-day moving average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout occurs but forward 5-day returns are ≤0% or regime reverts to NEUTRAL within 3 days >60% of occurrences.
